pageContext.claim: “Great Tweet today by Tyler Q. Houlton @SpoxDHS on the #FakeNews being put out by @CNN, a proud member of the Opposition Party. @TSA is doing a great job!”
pageContext.analysis: Trump praised a tweet by a Homeland Security spokesman pushing back against reports that some TSA agents were not showing up for work because they were not getting paid during the shutdown. But TSA later admitted the reports were correct and some airports had to curtail services. The agency said the workforce has "a national rate of 8 percent of unscheduled absences compared to a 3 percent rate one year ago" and "many employees are reporting that they are not able to report to work due to financial limitations."
